competitor.translation[0].definitions[0]: a person, team, company etc that is competing with another
Last year they sold twice as many computers as their competitors.

competitor.translation[0].definitions[1]: someone who takes part in a competition
Two of the competitors failed to turn up for the race.
competitor.translation[0].note_box[0].se: Japan soon became a major competitor in the electronics industry.
The company's main competitor is Vodafone.
He had five times as many votes as his nearest competitor.
The company's biggest competitor is in financial trouble.
America's electronics industry is keen to fight off foreign competitors.
He knew she was a successful businesswoman and a direct competitor.
In the global economy, China is emerging as a strong competitor.
He had prepared his daughter to be a fierce competitor.
A merger would also remove a potential competitor in the market.
competitor.translation[1].definitions[0]: a person, product, company, country etc that is competing with another
people who have tried our product or its direct competitor
Britain has had higher long-term interest rates than most of its major competitors.
